snippet: Sunday's Denver Broncos-Pittsburgh Steelers game was the highest-rated National Football League wild-card playoff game in 24 years.
abstract: Sunday's Denver Broncos-Pittsburgh Steelers game was the highest-rated National Football League wild-card playoff game in 24 years.
lead_paragraph: The victory of the Tim Tebow-led Denver Broncos over the Pittsburgh Steelers was the highest-rated National Football League wild-card playoff game in 24 years, averaging nearly 42 million viewers during the 7 p.m. hour on CBS on Sunday, according to preliminary overnight Nielsen estimates. Read more on the ArtsBeat blog »

headline.main: Tebow Leads Broncos to Victory, With 42 Million Following
